meanings.definition: The quality of pretending to be more important or intelligent than one actually is.
meanings.sent1: Her constant pretentiousnesses made it difficult to have genuine conversations with her.
meanings.sent2: His pretentiousnesses were evident in the way he always name-dropped famous people.
meanings.sent3: Despite her pretentiousnesses, she couldn't fool anyone with her lack of knowledge.
meanings.sent4: The pretentiousnesses of the peacock among the pigeons was quite comical.
meanings.sent5: The pretentiousnesses of the snobbish waiter left a lasting impression on the diners.

meanings.definition: The act of attempting to impress others by pretending to have greater knowledge or sophistication.
meanings.sent1: His constant pretentiousnesses in conversations were tiresome to listen to.
meanings.sent2: She used her pretentiousnesses to try to fit in with the intellectual crowd.
meanings.sent3: The pretentiousnesses of the know-it-all student were always met with eye rolls.
meanings.sent4: His pretentiousnesses were like a mask he wore to hide his insecurities.
meanings.sent5: The pretentiousnesses of the self-proclaimed expert were quickly exposed by real professionals.

meanings.definition: The behavior of putting on airs or acting in a way that is meant to impress others.
meanings.sent1: Their pretentiousnesses at the party were so obvious that no one took them seriously.
meanings.sent2: He adopted pretentiousnesses to try to gain respect from his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The pretentiousnesses of the actor were so over-the-top that the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her pretentiousnesses were like a costume she wore to play a role in society.
meanings.sent5: The pretentiousnesses of the socialite were like a shield to hide her true self from others.
